Red Sister by Mark Lawrence

I really like Mark Lawrence, his first trilogy the Prince of Thorns was great so I was looking forward to the first one in this trilogy (well, I’m assuming it’s a trilogy…..). This is a departure from the ‘grimdark’ styling of his first two trilogies and uses a woman as the main character rather than the male protagonists of the other two.

The writing is great and there is a confidence with both the world building and the use of multiple timelines.

Nona Grey is taken in by the convent of Sweet Mercy. It’s no ordinary convent and they train girls to be killers (the Red Sisters). In some the ‘old blood’ shows and with Nona, they’ve taken on more than they know.

Both the new world and the timelines are handled brilliantly. We are told Nonas past, her modern day training (which is like an all female Harry Potter with fight club), and her future - which hints at something very big and very bad happening between the three

I’ve got the second one to read, I picked up a signed copy from the Bristol Forbidden Planet, and if it is as this one, it’ll be a pleasure to read.

Feel free to share!
